Package ohos.agp.text

Class TextLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.text.TextLayout

  • public class TextLayout
extends Object
    A default implementation class for text layout, which supports both plain text and rich text. In addition, the text layout can be edited. TextLayout does not directly generate layouts in the constructor. Instead, it generates layouts only when you explicitly call doLayout(). You can use setters to change your input data and call doLayout() to lay out the text. The default values are used for the APIs that are not explicitly set. For details, see the description of each API.
    Since:
    7

      Enumerates the text justification strategies.

      Enumerates the line breaking strategies.

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TextLayout​()
      A constructor used to create a TextLayout instance without any parameter.

      A constructor used to create a TextLayout instance with the specified text, paint attribute of the text, and maximum width of the text.

      A constructor used to create a TextLayout instance with the specified richText, paint attribute of the text, and maximum width of the text.

    • Field Detail

      • mPaint

        protected Paint mPaint
        Used for paint reference. The value must not be null.

      • mRichText

        protected RichText mRichText
        Used for RichText reference. The value must be null in the plain text case.

      • mText

        protected String mText
        Used for plain text reference. The value must be null in the rich text case.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextLayout

        public TextLayout​()
        A constructor used to create a TextLayout instance without any parameter. You need to set parameters before calling doLayout().
        Since:
        7

      • TextLayout

        public TextLayout​(String text,
                  Paint paint,
                  int widthLimit)
           throws NullPointerException
        A constructor used to create a TextLayout instance with the specified text, paint attribute of the text, and maximum width of the text. This constructor will leave the other parameters as default. You can set the other parameters before calling doLayout().
        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the text to set.
        paint - Indicates the paint used for drawing text.
        widthLimit - Indicates the maximum width of the text.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if any parameter is null.
        Since:
        7

      • TextLayout

        public TextLayout​(RichText richText,
                  Paint paint,
                  int widthLimit)
           throws NullPointerException
        A constructor used to create a TextLayout instance with the specified richText, paint attribute of the text, and maximum width of the text. This constructor will leave the other parameters as default. You can set the other parameters before calling doLayout().
        Parameters:
        richText - Indicates the RichText.
        paint - Indicates the paint used for drawing text.
        widthLimit - Indicates the maximum width of the text.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if any parameter is null.
        Since:
        7

      • setBidiStrategy

        public void setBidiStrategy​(BidiAnalyzer.BidiStrategy bidi)
        Sets the bidirectional text recognition strategy for this TextLayout.

        The default bidirectional text recognition strategy is FIRSTSTRONG_OR_LTR.

        Parameters:
        bidi - Indicates the bidirectional text recognition strategy to set.
        Since:
        7

      • setFallbackFontMetricsEnabled

        public void setFallbackFontMetricsEnabled​(Boolean fallbackFontMetricsEnabled)
        Sets whether to enable ascent or descent metrics for fallback fonts.
        Parameters:
        fallbackFontMetricsEnabled - Specifies whether to enable fallback font metrics. The value true means to enable ascent or descent metrics for fallback fonts, and false means the opposite. The default value is true.
        Since:
        7

      • doLayout

        public void doLayout​()
        Lays out the text.

        The speed of this method depends on the previous setters. The layout can be obtained through a Get method only after doLayout() is called.

        Since:
        7

      • drawText

        public void drawText​(Canvas canvas)
        Draws text on the specified canvas object after the layout is complete.

        You may need to perform translation and clipping manually.

        Parameters:
        canvas - Indicates the Canvas object.
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        Canvas.clipRect(Rect), Canvas.translate(float, float)

        Since:

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth​(boolean withTrailingSpace)
        Obtains the width of the longest line, in this TextLayout.
        Parameters:
        withTrailingSpace - Specifies whether to include trailing spaces. The value true means to include the trailing spaces, and false means the opposite.

        public float getLineWidth​(int line)

        Returns:

        7

        Returns the width if obtained; returns -1.0f if the value of line is invalid.

      • getLineAscent

        public float getLineAscent​(int line)
        Obtains the ascent of a specific line in this TextLayout. Note that the ascent is a relative and negative value from the baseline.
        Parameters:
        line - Indicates the line.
        Returns:
        Returns the ascent if obtained; returns 1.0f if the value of line is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • getLineDescent

        public float getLineDescent​(int line)
        Obtains the descent of a specific line in this TextLayout. Note that the descent is a relative and positive value from the baseline.
        Parameters:
        line - Indicates the line.
        Returns:
        Returns the descent if obtained; returns -1.0f if the value of line is invalid.
        Since:
        7

        public int getLineIndexByCoordinate​(float coordinateY)
        Obtains the index of the line that is located at a specific vertical coordinate.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Returns the line index in the range from 0 to the total line number minus 1. You can use getLineCount() to obtain the total line number.
        Since:
        7

      • getLineStartPosition

        public float getLineStartPosition​(int line)
        Obtains the horizontal coordinate of the start of a specific line, including indents.

        Note that the start position is on the right side in the RTL case.

        Parameters:
        line - Indicates the line.
        Returns:
        Returns the horizontal coordinate if obtained; returns -1.0f if the value of line is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • getLineStartPosition

        public float getLineStartPosition​(int line,
                                  boolean withIndent)
        Obtains the horizontal coordinate of the start of a specific line.

        Note that the start position is on the right side in the RTL case.

        Parameters:
        line - Indicates the line.
        withIndent - Specifies whether to include indents. The value true means to include indents, and false means the opposite.
        Returns:
        Returns the horizontal coordinate if obtained; returns -1.0f if the value of line is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • getLineLeftPosition

        public float getLineLeftPosition​(int line)
        Obtains the leftmost horizontal coordinate of the specified line, including indents and trailing spaces.

        This method is the same as getLineStartPosition(int) in the LTR case.

        Parameters:
        line - Indicates the line.
        Returns:
        Returns the horizontal coordinate if obtained; returns -1.0f if the value of line is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • getLineLeftPosition

        public float getLineLeftPosition​(int line,
                                 boolean withIndentOrSpace)
        Obtains the leftmost horizontal coordinate of the specified line.

        This method is the same as getLineStartPosition(int,boolean) in the LTR case.

        Parameters:
        line - Indicates the line.
        withIndentOrSpace - Specifies whether to include indents and trailing spaces. The value true means to include indents and trailing spaces, and false means the opposite.
        Returns:
        Returns the horizontal coordinate if obtained; returns -1.0f if the value of line is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • getLineEndPosition

        public float getLineEndPosition​(int line)
        Obtains the horizontal coordinate of the end of a specific line, including trailing spaces.

        Note that the end position is on the left side in the RTL case.

        Parameters:
        line - Indicates the line.
        Returns:
        Returns the horizontal coordinate if obtained; returns -1.0f if the value of line is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • isLineWithTab

        public boolean isLineWithTab​(int line)
        Checks whether the specified line contains tab characters.
        Parameters:
        line - Indicates the line.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the specified line contains any tab character; returns false otherwise.
        Since:

      • getOffsetByCoordinates

        public int getOffsetByCoordinates​(float x,
                                  float y)
        Obtains the offset of the character that is closest to the given coordinates.

        Note that the offset ranges from 0 to the text length, that is, the offset may be the last character index plus 1.

        Parameters:
        x - Indicates the x-coordinate.
        y - Indicates the y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        Returns the offset.
        Since:
        7

      • getOffsetByCoordinate

        public int getOffsetByCoordinate​(int line,
                                 float coordinateX)
        Obtains the offset of the character that is closest to the given horizontal coordinate in a specific line.

        Note that the offset ranges from 0 to the text length, that is, the offset may be the last character index plus 1.

        Parameters:
        line - Indicates the line.
        coordinateX - Indicates the given horizontal position.
        Returns:
        Returns the offset if obtained; returns -1 if the value of line is invalid.
        Since:
        7

      • getCursorCoordinates

        public Point getCursorCoordinates​(int offset)
        Obtains the cursor position of a specific text offset.
        Parameters:
        offset - Indicates the text offset.
        Returns:
        Returns the cursor position.
        Since:

      • getCursorHorizontalCoordinate

        public float getCursorHorizontalCoordinate​(int offset)

        Parameters:
        offset - Indicates the text offset.
        Returns:
        Returns the cursor's horizontal position.
        Since:
        7

      • getOffsetByMoveDirection

        public int getOffsetByMoveDirection​(int offset,
                                    TextLayout.CursorMoveDirection direction)
        Obtains the target cursor offset with the specified direction.

        Note that this method does not move the cursor, but only returns the offset of the cursor.

        Parameters:
        offset - Indicates the current cursor offset.
        direction - Indicates the direction of cursor movement.
        Returns:
        Returns the target cursor offset.
        Since:
        7
